headline: WLWT News 5 to broadcast live Ohio US Senate debate
author: WLWT Digital Staff
sentences: "The Menard Family Center for Democracy is proud to partner with WLWT News 5 in bringing this important discussion to Miami's campus,” said John Forren, associate professor and chair of the Department of Justice and Community Studies, and Executive Director of the Menard Family Center for Democracy.

“This year, Ohio is a key battleground for control of the U.S. Senate, and this debate will help voters throughout the region to learn more about both the candidates who are vying to represent us in Washington and the issues that will define American politics in the years ahead."

OXFORD, Ohio —
WLWT News 5 and Miami University will host the Ohio U.S. Senate Republican Primary Debate on the Oxford campus Tuesday, April 5 from 7 to 8 p.m. in Armstrong Student Center’s Wilks Theatre.
The event is a collaboration between WLWT News 5, which will broadcast the debate live and stream it on WLWT.com and the WLWT app, and Miami University’s Menard Family Center for Democracy.
We are honored and excited to partner with Miami University for this important conversation," said WLWT President and General Manager Branden Frantz.
It is our commitment to our communities to ensure our viewers know who the candidates are and what they stand for."
Five candidates for the Ohio Republican nomination – Matt Dolan, Mike Gibbons, Josh Mandel, Jane Timken, and J.D.
The event is free and open to the public, and tickets are available at the Miami University Box Office website.
Doors open at 5:30 p.m., and close promptly at 6:30 p.m. to prepare for the live broadcast; no exceptions.
Large bags, signs, campaign materials, noisemakers, water bottles and video recording are not permitted.
“Today's political climate continues to demonstrate the importance of these types of discussions.
This is the third and final debate between the candidates and the only one in Southwest Ohio.
No one will be allowed in the auditorium after 6:30 p.m. No re-entry after 6:30 p.m.
"This debate is a key part of our Commitment 2022 comprehensive coverage.
Ticketholders should anticipate a security screen and plan accordingly.
WLWT News 5 Anchor Sheree Paolello will moderate the debate.
Seats not filled at 6:30 p.m. will be forfeited.
Vance – will address the concerns of voters.
